ratings.comment: There were a lot of mistakes made in lectures that left a lot of students who didn't catch the mistakes really confused. She assumed the class was more advanced in their understanding than we ever were. If you asked questions in lecture, she generally made you feel as if you were dumb, and then didn't really explain the answer directly.

She is a bad professor. I once asked her the week before the exam to help me with office hours and she said no, she was too busy with other things. I asked the other professor a few days before the next exam and he was able to find a time to help me with no issue. Palladino also gets a lot wrong in class and makes everything super confusing.

She will go over the easiest topics in class while ignoring the hard ones. Any math you have to use in lab and discussions will not be gone over by her during class. She takes decades on things that should take two seconds and never gets to the things we need to learn. The class is not hard, but she makes it hard.

It's physics. It's tough. But it's made even harder when your professor jumbles her words at least once a lecture. Seems like she knows the material well but her method of communication is mediocre. The slides are trying too hard to be "relatable". The final exam was cumulative, no partial credit, and the curve was essentially non-existent. G'luck.
She makes at least 3 mistakes per lecture. She is also incredibly condescending and rude to students.
I pretty good at explaining the material, and is reasonably engaging. Not really much else to say.

Kim is by far the best physics professor I have had! She is very willing to help and she explains stuff well. I am doing much better in physics this semester than I did last semester and I think that is because of Kim. If you have to take physics definitely take the class with her!
